title: How do music artists get paid when they are featured on someone else's song? - Quora

response.answer_text: First: “featuring” is a marketing device in the music business. So you feature an artist with a different (but often overlapping) target audience and hope to increase your fan range that way. If it is done well, it is a win for both artists – even without getting paid. Other than that, it depends on how deeply the featured artist is involved. If she co-wrote the song, she will get license fees from every broadcast, concert or download. If the featured artist merely acts as a performer, he will usually get paid for each performance (plus extra fees for broadcasted performances) like a regular band musician. It is totally possible to arrange other deals and pay a featured artist for the opportunity to have his fans listen to your music. In that case you could think of the featured artist as a widely viewed TV series and you buy an advertisement spot for your music on it ;). Or it is the other way round: the featured artist actually pays the featuring artist to have his name exposed to a new fan base. There are no rules for these kinds of deals – it’s a negotiation thing.
